Review Title: Perfect location, warm, inviting & knowledgable staff ‚Äì ideal for a first-timer and solo traveller!
Negative Reviews: The lady on the concierge desk when John wasn't available wasn't anywhere need as helpful or accommodating to help a traveller book a day trip, which resulted in having to travel to Fisherman's Wharf's information centre and book the same trip (same company) myself. A phone call doesn't go astray. I communicated this to staff who apologised on her behalf.
Positive Reviews:
It was my first time in San Francisco and as a solo traveller I was hesitant if I had chosen the right location to stay in. I absolutely did!! Union square was central to everything via transport or on foot. The hotel itself had a welcoming, warm feeling that always made me feel safe, with 24-hr lobby staff. 
My experience on check-in was with a bubbly, friendly lady which couldn't have been more accomodating (wears a bow in hair - she was wonderful!) 
The rooms were cleaned daily and had everything I needed for a six-day stay. 
A HUGE shoutout to John (I hope that name is correct) at the front concierge desk. He is AMAZING! So knowledgeable! I wish I had spoken with him sooner. He showed me the areas to avoid, and the best methods of transport to get to my destinations and advice on how to pay/manage travel on the cable cars (even the best line to take for fun!) The Handerly Hotel is lucky to have him. He was an absolutely highlight and a pleasure to have met!

We actually had fragile items and our work laptops in our bags and preferred to handle them ourselves. We were also going to repack some of our things in the lobby, but Jack took our bags to the door. We didn‚Äôt have enough cash on us and knew we could not tip him anyway, so his insistence made it very difficult and awkward for us, especially since we really didn‚Äôt need help with our bags. It also did not help that he loaded two bags that were not ours and luckily we corrected him and he gave us the right ones. Didn‚Äôt seem very professional considering how another guest could have easily claimed the bag was theirs and made off with it. He was also visibly disappointed at not being given a tip, and we are sorry about not being able to give him that tip. But we just wanted him to hand us back our luggages from the storage and did not need or want his help with them. That being said, this was probably the only less positive experience and even then, it was understandable.

The two queen beds were extremely comfortable as well. The location was great. And the pool was a special bonus which the kids loved! Review Title: Perfect location for first time to SF.
Negative Reviews: For me - nothing. Was completely satisfied. The room and bathrooms were CLEAN and sheets and towels still white - my number priority anywhere I stay.
Positive Reviews: It was our first time in SF and we asked for a room with a street view. Our request was not only accommodated but we were also upgraded to a bigger room in the new wing. The front desk staff, the concierge and the cleaning crew were friendly and helpful. The location was PERFECT! Union Square is a stone's throw away (literally). You only needed to walk to the corner and go to all the stores - from Macy's to high-end brand boutiques. We also caught the Big Bus for a quick view of the city at that corner. The street cars and cable cars and buses - all within a 5-15 minute walk (depending on how fast you walk). Boudin Bakery round the corner and in the Macy basement. In the new wing, we could go out the back/side entrances so after a long day walking, any shortcuts were appreciated. SFMOMA is a 15 minute walk away. Will definitely stay here again. Handlery has an old-world charm about it so while the furnishing is dated, it felt nice coming back to staff who greet you every time you walk through the door or ask about your day out. They even kept something in the freezer for me till I left as the room had a small fridge. Street is quiet but you can sometimes hear music or revellers at the bars nearby. Did not bother us at all.
Room Type: Double Room with Two Double Beds

Review Title: Good hotel right in the downtown
Negative Reviews:
There were couple of things that had a little impact on my evaluation:
- Reception area had a "funny" smell, when entering the hotel. I was afraid at first that room will have the same smell, but it didn't fortunately. Maybe something to look at, because reception is really the place that makes the first impression on customers.
- Parking price was 65 USD + tax I guess - a bit too expensive, considering that you could park in the parking nearby for 35 USD (incl. tax). Not very customers-friendly.
- On one of the days, there was a demonstration right in front of the hotel (people were complaining about G Hotel or something), but they've been shouting outside for a good couple of hours right in the morning. Maybe not something that hotel can influence directly, but definitely wasn't the best part of my trip.
Positive Reviews:
Location was definitely one of the best features of this hotel!
It is right across the corner from the Union Square and has all necessary places right around it: diners, coffee, shops, pharmacy, malls, etc.
Room was very spacious for two people! Room had all necessary equipment, incl. tea/coffee machine, fridge, safe, iron, etc.
Bathroom was spacious too and very clean.
Value for money, staff very helpful

Positive Reviews:
A nice hotel in a central location. Clean, spacious rooms. No breakfast, but the hotel recommends one of the local diners and provides a discount card to use for every morning of the stay.
We had received an outstanding service upon checkin. Dave (if i remember correctly) at the reception, while chatting to us about the trip and the plans, when found out it was our honeymoon trip, kindly upgraded our room and sent us a bottle of fizz. It was truly magical and made our stay special.
Room was quiet.

The excessive noises from outside that can be heard from the room. Also unfortunately the surroundings don't look safe these days.

Negative Reviews:
My room was very small and dated and had a slight odour.  I was exhausted from a 5hr drive so sprayed perfume rather than moving rooms.  I needed sleep.  
It's an old style, rabbit warren of a hotel.  I am not suggesting for a second that it's not safe but I was very relieved to have a room with a fire escape stairwell right next to it.  I took wrong turns going to the lift every time, so knowing I only had to step left in an emergency was good.
(I caveat this was probably not helped by being reminded on all the tours, that Towering Inferno was filmed nearby - and that film traumatised me as a child!!)
I did feel the Westin was only marginally more expensive on the nights I booked and would actually have been better value in hindsight.  So depends if you prioritise absolute prices or value per dollar spent.
It's worth bearing in mind, it's in the part of the city where you see the homeless.  I never felt unsafe - they are just people who life has let down after all.  But you should be ready for it. Also the dept stores all closed on Easter Sunday which caught a lot of us visitors out.  Absolutely not the hotel's fault and not a big problem but again something to consider when planning your stay.
Positive Reviews:
Location is good if you want to be in the shopping district.  Some gorgeous buildings in the vicinity, if you like that kind of thing - I do.  Danny the concierge is a hero and couldn't have been more helpful.  
It was about a 30 min walk to the Ferry Terminal   for context.  There is public transport but the weather was nice.

Something else to be aware of is that some rooms aren't attached to the main building directly and you need to climb a flight of stairs before getting to the elevator. This wasn't an issue for us and there's a lift for people living with a disability to access but it would be worth mentioning when you book if this would be a difficulty for you.

Review Title: Always have a soft spot for SFO!
Negative Reviews:
SFO has a bad homeless problem that's getting worse. It's a shame and at times heart breaking to see these young people.
If you've never been to SFO, it's very in your face. We weren't hassled by anyone. But it can be an eye opener.
The whole city wreaks of weed and wee!
See past that and it's still a great base for a West coast adventure, to start a cruise as we did or just visit the city
Positive Reviews:
Nice big room, bit of a hike to get to but worth it.
We been to SFO and stayed before, so we had an idea of the location of the hotel.
Close to Union Square, shops and bars. Still classed as near/in the financial district, so much quieter in the area than our visit in 2019, following from the pandemic. 
Nice Irish bar very close by. Good location for seeing the sights.
Accommodation in SFO isn't cheap, wherever you stay. We used this hotel as a stopover, before joining a ship the next day.

Given a voucher for discount off at the diner around the corner - think everyone in the area had a voucher as we did have to queue outside for a while.  Shame the hotel didnt have an open bar/restaurant of their own.  Minor issue though as we thoroughly enjoyed our stay

It is located very close to Tenderloin - the main homeless area. While there were some homeless people on the streets, they did not cause any trouble or make me feel unsafe - this is a generic comment on downtown San Francisco rather than the hotel itself. At no time did we feel unsafe, but homelessness is a significant and visible problem in San Francisco, so it is good to be aware of it and be prepared. 
There were no in-house dining options (I assume not reopened since Covid restrictions), but this wasn't an issue as there are nearby options for eating and also food deliveries if you want to eat in your room.
Positive Reviews:
Nice family room in the older part of the hotel, which still had original charm and old features. Some people may not like this, but we did. 
Very centrally located, just 2 minutes walk from Union Square and public transport (including the Cable Cars). 
We chose this hotel based on location, in-house parking, and also the swimming pool which was not too busy and great to relax by in the evening (closes at 8pm) or during the day if you're taking a break from sightseeing.

The Hotel is on Geary St and the end of that block is Mason St and is where the Tenderloin area starts and is to be avoided. We were not aware and nobody mentioned it to us when venturing out. Lots of zombie like street people in this area as there is around Union Square and down Powell St. where the street car turnaround is. This is nothing to do with the hotel but is part of the experience because of where it's situated.

Review Title: A good central place, but a bit too expensive for what you get...
Negative Reviews:
Parking wasn't easy. There's a backyard parking that you can use to offload your luggage but they only give you 20 free minutes (you have to pay if you stay longer). Also, this information wasn't entirely obvious, we almost got a fine for initially parking in front of the hotel, before finding out about the other parking lot.
Also, some of the staff didn't seem particularly happy about helping us when we needed it, still, they clearly wanted a tip and made it evident at every occasion...
No breakfast is available (at all, in the premise), but you get get a 20% voucher (one time only) for a bar nearby.
Finally, the place is nice but a bit wore off in the furniture and the interiors.

When I checked out I was faced with two flights of stairs to get to the parking garage. The elevator didn't work the first two times I tried so I didn't chance it. I'm not disabled but have mobility issues and this was quite challenging. Thankfully a nice worker came by and carried my bag up the stairs for me to make it easier.  Sadly, I may have to stop staying at this property going forward.

Review Title: Think twice before staying at this hotel because even bottles must be kept at the safer
Negative Reviews: This hotel's safer should be bigger, considering that even bottles need to be kept there to not be taken by others. I had an extremely unpleasant and uncomfortable experience at this hotel because of this occurrence and the hotel management ignored my report and made almost no effort to resolve it, even though the housekeeper had confessed that the item was taken from the bedside table. Only after the 4th attempt and having waited for more than 30 minutes at the reception, I was able to speak with the manager, who trivialized the occurrence and the monetary value of the missing item. The problem is that the item might not have significant monetary value, but it had great sentimental value by the memories it represented.

Review Title: Some Good, Some Bad -- But a mostly comfortable stay
Negative Reviews:
A note about staff: we didn't interact with many staff at all, and none of the cleaning staff. I don't want to get anyone in trouble, so I will be vague about certain details, but it did impact my stay enough to warrant a mention. Firstly, my partner and I aren't the best dressed--we're often mistaken for being homeless, and having just come in from the Pride event, we looked a bit worse for wear. In the course of events, I noticed that, while we were met with curt, quick comments and what seemed to be an air of disdain, there was a much more pleasant attitude to the other guests. I don't really care about this, personally, but it saddens me to think this might be a common experience for people who *are* struggling and/or just trying to find a nice place to stay. The second thing regarding staff, which did bother me personally, was that despite being referred to as male by my partner (and having male designations on my profile), I was misgendered by a member of staff who was definitely aware of the preference. They immediately corrected, but it was extremely frustrating, especially having just come from Pride and wearing trans colors prominently. It was overall uncomfortable and disheartening.

Beyond that, the only other issues were a few things in the room. The first is that the window in the bathroom wouldn't latch shut, so we did hear a lot of outside noise pretty prominently. This wouldn't have been as much of an issue, if it weren't for the bathroom door. The door to the bathroom didn't slide open easily, getting stuck halfway. I must admit that if it weren't for my partner, I wouldn't have been able to open it myself. The last thing is that the towels in the shower area were a bit too high for me to reach from the wheelchair, but there was a towel placed on the back of the toilet, so I was able to access that myself without trouble. I also appreciated that the mat was placed on the toilet within easy reach.
Positive Reviews:
I liked that the hotel is close to Westfield Shopping center, Trader Joe's, and bus terminals; so we were able to find a space to explore within a reasonable distance as well as travel around the city. When I mentioned prior to arrival that I would be arriving in a wheelchair, the awesome staff updated us to an accessible queen room at no additional cost, and it made the stay much more comfortable overall--I was surprised at how comfortable the bed was! 

The curtains were great at blocking out light and were easily adjustable. We had plenty of room, with the shower being fully accessible (minus one or two details, listed below), including a fold down seat and reachable handles with lower shower head. 

The mini fridge (which I didn't notice at first!) was really helpful, since I (unfortunately) have an extremely limited diet which requires a lot of produce and perishable foods. I appreciated the access to the cold storage very much!

I thought it was pretty cool that it was a historical hotel, and enjoyed seeing the post box (and the letter slots in the upper floor!).

Review Title: Outdated facilities and rooms in dire need of a facelift
Negative Reviews: By far one of the most disappointing hotel experiences I've encountered, given the value of the rooms were nowhere near commensurate to how oudated the facilities were. The room was clean, but had I knew how dingy and old the room/hotel facilities were, I would not have paid the money that I did to stay just the two nights here. The view looking out was also appalling, despite my requests for a city view. Instead, my view looked out to a square block of the adjoining hotel rooms, and just wasn't what I had hoped for. Upon checking in, I observed a hotel guest complaining to management about issues with the shower and overall functionality of the room, which in hindsight, should have been a dead giveaway just how my stay was going to be no different. The fact that management confirmed, in writing, that the hotel had gone through a recent renovation (including to the bathrooms) is false and misleading in my opinion. The bathroom appeared to be very retro-like, and looked as if it hadn't been given a facelift since the 1980s. Overall, the pictures online just didn't match the quality and state of the rooms in real life.
